body.name: SINGER SteamCraft Plus Digital Display Iron, Five Fabric Settings, OnPoint Tip for Easy Ironing, 1750W, Vertical Steam, 300ml Tank, Stainless Steel Soleplate, Auto Shut Off after 30 Minutes
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 10 hrs 48 mins
features: The SINGER Steamcraft Plus Iron is designed for the sewist or the avid ironer. With an ergonomic design and focus on fabric care, the SINGER Steamcraft Plus 2.0 iron produces a first-rate pressing and fabric steaming experience.
ONPOINT TIP TECHNOLOGY (patent pending)-easily iron around buttons, seams, and pleats for a crisp finish. Experience how Singer's OnPoint tip technology helps to iron hard to reach areas on garments!
STRONG BURST OF STEAM-Enjoy expert results with 1750 watts of steam. Watch wrinkles fade away as you relax your fabrics with steam and then easily press creases.

DIGITAL DISPLAY-Always have the right heat for the fabric you are ironing! The digital display includes five fabric options so you never have to worry about burning your fabric. Options include Linen, Cotton, Wool, Silk, and Nylon.

30-MINUTE VERTICAL AUTO OFF DELAY-Keeps your iron ready during long projects. Many other irons shut off after 1-15 minutes which can be frustrating when you are in the middle of a project. SINGER Steamcraft irons await your next press!
VERTICAL STEAM MODE-easily steam the wrinkles out of curtains and delicate garments.

LARGE WATER TANK-Less refills are needed with the 300ml water tank. Enjoy an easy-fill, no-drip water tank with large filler opening. The iron Includes an internal anti-calcium filter that makes the iron tap water safe.
12 FOOT 360 DEGREE CORD-Increase your range of movement while ironing with this useful feature.
QUALITY CHECKED-Every Singer Iron is 100% Quality Checked. We also test the steam function with water.
STAINLESS STEEL SOLEPLATE-The smooth Stainless Steel surface heats up ultra-fast for quicker results.
body.description: The SINGER SteamCraft Plus iron produces a top-notch ironing experience for you and your fabric! SINGER knows how important your fabric is and the importance of professional ironing results. With Singer's OnPoint tip technology, easily iron around buttons, seams, and pleats for a crisp finish. The 12 foot 360 degree cord lets you move comfortably around your ironing surface making pressing and steaming your fabrics even easier. Enjoy expert results with 1750 watts of steam. Watch wrinkles fade away as you relax your fabrics with steam and then easily press creases. With the SINGER SteamCraft iron, enjoy the pressing and steaming results you are looking for!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Your Hunt for the Perfect Iron is Over! Your fabric will look and feel its best with the SINGER SteamCraft Plus iron! Since 1851, SINGER has been the trusted leader in fabric care. We have applied over 170 years of experience working with fabrics to develop our durable, consumer-inspired garment care products such as irons. With an ergonomic design and focus on fabric care, the SINGER SteamCraft Plus iron produces a first-rate pressing and fabric steaming experience.

The SINGER SteamCraft Plus iron provides the pressing and steaming results you need! SINGER knows how important your fabric is and the importance of professional ironing results. The SINGER SteamCraft Plus iron produces a top-notch ironing experience for you and your fabric! Here are just a few features that set this special iron apart. With SINGER's OnPoint tip technology, easily iron around buttons, seams, and pleats for a crisp finish. The 12 foot 360 degree cord lets you move comfortably around your ironing surface making pressing and steaming your fabrics even easier. Enjoy expert results with 1750 watts of steam. Watch wrinkles fade away as you relax your fabrics with steam and then easily press creases. SINGER SteamCraft irons have internal anti-calcium filters so they are tap water safe.

ONPOINT TIP TECHNOLOGY (patent pending) Easily iron around buttons, seams, and pleats for a crisp finish. Experience how Singer's OnPoint tip technology helps to iron hard to reach areas on garments. STRONG BURST OF STEAM Enjoy expert results with 1750 watts of steam. Watch wrinkles fade away as you relax your fabrics with steam and then easily press creases. Burst of Steam - 1.2g per shot 72g/min WORKS FOR ALL FABRICS Always have the right heat for the fabric you are ironing! The digital display includes five fabric options so you never have to worry about burning your fabric.

LARGE WATER TANK Less refills are needed with the 300ml water tank. Enjoy an easy-fill, no-drip water tank with large filler opening. SteamCraft irons have internal anti-calcium filters so they are tap water safe. Enjoy an extra large & transparent water tank. 30-MINUTE VERTICAL AUTO-OFF We know it can be frustrating when you're in the middle of a project, ready to press a seam, and your iron is no longer hot. The SINGER SteamCraft Plus iron will stay hot for 30 minutes in a vertical, motionless position before the auto shut off safety feature engages. Other irons will shut off between 1-15 minutes. STAINLESS STEEL SOLE PLATE Stainless steel soleplates have the best glide over all of your fabrics. Plus it heats up faster and more evenly, for a smooth ironing experience.

SINGER SteamCraft Iron SINGER SteamCraft Plus Iron OnPoint Tip ✓ ✓ Precision Digital Controls ✓ ✓ 300 mL Water Tank Capacity ✓ ✓ Cord Length (ft) 10 12 Watts 1700 1750 Continuous Steam Output 15-17 g/min 20 g/min

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Heavy Iron, Very Nice Features
reviews.reviewText: This is a solid iron. I haven't used a heavy iron since I used my mom's iron. The color is a nice touch. I like the design. I saw good and bad reviews, so I decided to review the instructions all the way through just to make sure I won't miss anything. They recommend doing a Self Clean once a month to clear out build up. To use iron first time on a towel or something durable. Before adding water make sure it's not on, unplugged. And a bunch of other common sense instructions. I like the extra long cord. The base when upright, is a nice rubber base so it won't slide off a hard surface. They give you a measuring cup for the water, I like that. There is a dial with 3 settings, Self Clean, steam and no steam. Steam only works on 2 highest temp settings. The water door is plastic, same as the top of the iron. The water cup has a nice spout for pouring. I can see without the cup it would be easy to overfill, so I appreciate the water cup. When you plug it in, the red light comes on and blinks on the mode button. Temperature settings are easy, push mode button to go up in settings, nylon, silk, wool, cotton & linen. Directions say if you're not sure, start with lowest setting and try that first. I tested on a cotton towel first as recommended. Then onto to a satin tank. So I switched temps from cotton down to nylon, as I had no idea what satin is. Takes awhile for the iron to cool down to a lower temp, but I was able to tell it was too low of a setting. The wrinkes didn't come out, so I went up to Silk Temperature, which worked nicely. The temp setting will blink until ready also. I really like the soul plate, I sew alot, and like the tip of the iron with the weight, before I had to add weight when ironing because it was a light iron. This will be so much easier. I like the water spray button it casts a nice light even spray for a good amount of time. Very light mist. The steam button gives a nice blast, it only works when you are on the highest 2 settings, linen and cotton. And, you need to pause 2 seconds between pushing it. The handle has a comfortable fit. And it seems when not in use the cup fits in the handle nicely. I feel the features are good on this iron. Not my first iron, I've only used light weight cheap irons before. This is well made. I recommend it. Will update my review if anything changes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Love the color, good quality for the price

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Do not buy this iron
reviews.reviewText: It doesn't steam all the time, I have to press the steam button several times while I am using it. the on button is in the wrong place, constantly pressing it while ironing and it turns off.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is what an iron should be- I love this iron!
reviews.reviewText: I've had several irons from moderately priced to higher-end irons, none have made me happier than this iron. It's a perfect weight, hasn't leaked all over my items, steams great & as a quilter the pointed tip is amazing! I also love the mint color. I highly HIGHLY recommend this iron and would love to see a smaller/travel size, fingers crossed!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars My favorite color!
reviews.reviewText: Honestly, I bought this iron because of the color. It matches my kitchen, and I love it. My Rowenta needed a repair/replacement part and I needed something to fill the gap.This is a midrange price iron but it has some great features and it works well.I really like that the cord is so long. If I want to plug it in to iron on my tabletop board really quick in the bathroom, there is plenty of cord to do so, without the added danger or inconvenience of an extension cord.The display is LED, not a dial, so it’s very easy to see what’s what. It’s also very clear when the iron is on and ready to go. There is also an automatic shut off so there is no need to worry. When you come back and pick up the iron it awakens and heats up fast.The water well is easy to fill and takes tap water. It holds quite a bit too.The iron isn’t very heavy, but it gets the job done.It isn’t continuous steam, but it does give out a nice burst of steam with the button. I will be using this as a backup iron in my closet/bathroom for touch ups and quick iron sessions. Or when I just want that cute pop of color!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Poor design, developed a leak
reviews.reviewText: I have had this iron for two years. It heats quickly and steams well but has a maddening design flaw. The temperature adjustment is a button built into the center of the hand grip. It is damnably difficult to use the iron without inadvertently toggling through the temperature settings until you find the iron is sticking to the fabric because it is too hot or sputtering because it has been turned off. Did no one at Singer ever use this iron?I've tolerated this for two years but recently I found the iron sitting upright in a puddle of water. Investigation revealed that water now trickles out of the iron, some seal having failed. The iron has been lightly used, never dropped, and never mishandled (see photos). I wrote Singer for product support. They replied that it wasa. out of warranty, andb. was not supposed to be stored with water in the tank.Except I never have drained an iron before I stored it in the 60 years I've used one. This is the first iron for me that has failed in this manner.Singer could have and should have replaced this iron. More and more companies that deal through Amazon understand that an "it's on us" response builds customer loyalty and benefits them in the long-run. Good job Singer, for saving yourself the cost of an iron.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great steaming iron for fabric crafts
reviews.reviewText: This iron is great. It steams immediately, and so far, so good.
La relación calidad-precio del producto es magnífica. Aparte la marca singer es garantía de buen producto y buena calidad, satisfecho con el producto.

I have probably had 10 irons over the years and this one hands down is the best. Heats up super fast - about 30 seconds. Auto off delay is 30 minutes, which is great when sewing. It has a good weight to it, the cord is long and is thicker than any iron cord I have had. I tested it on some fabric that has been folded for years and it was a breeze. Only small drawback is the on off switch is on the handle and I turned it off accidentally, but not enough of a drawback to alter rating. I purchased this on sale but would have paid full price.

Sewing and crafting have been big past times of mine, and even occasionally a cosplay seamstress. My old T-fal iron, my love from 2008 (made in France, the whole thing!) was accidentally dropped and sadly on it’s last burst of steam. The T-fal iron had offered me durilium glide, non-scratch, non-stick resistance features that I needed, so I thought to be buying another T-fal iron... BUTThis Singer SteamCraft Plus Iron always intrigued me. Below is what I look for in an iron, though not always in this order.- Aesthetic, I'd like it to not look bad.- Cord length, has to be long.- Weight, can't be too heavy (I'm not a bodybuilder!)- Performance help, quality of life features that make it easy to work with.The Singer SteamCraft Plus Iron answered all those needs, and more!- Pretty to look at, minty green, simple clean design.- Extra long cord, at 12 feet.- Weight I can handle, only 3.30 pounds.And for the quality of life features:- The water level can be seen.- Visually see and operate settings fast, no wondering what does what, or pausing looking for a button.- 30 minute auto shut off, self explanatory.- Long pointy reaching tip, full heat gets applied to hard to reach areas.- Old school stainless steel sole plate.- Lots of steam holes, for lots of steam.- Rubber grip on the resting bottom of the iron, so it won't budge/slip.Overall, a very thoughtful, thoughtful iron.Happily Impressed!
Me gustó el modelo y el diseño, si trabajas con distintos tipos de tela esta muy bien, pero no hay indicaciones para saber que temperatura tiene
